snippet: Even as Afghan and American officials insist they will not allow another urban center to fall, the noose is tightening around Lashkar Gah in Helmand Province....
abstract: Afghan security forces are relying on American airstrikes to stop Taliban offensive in Helmand Province, forcing residents to flee and raising questions about sustainability of such attacks.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Mohammad Fahim Abed contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Even as Afghan and American officials insist they will not allow another urban center to fall, the noose is tightening around Lashkar Gah in Helmand Province.

headline.main: Airstrikes Barely Holding Off Taliban in Helmand, Afghan Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Airstrikes Are Barely Holding Off Taliban in Helmand, Afghan Officials Say

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
